pageContext.claim: “While they're working on impeachment, we were working on doing this because we were hearing about it while they were wasting the country's time and the world's time, talking about the impeachment hoax. And they got shut out, except for one very foolish, frankly, not a very good senator. A man who got in on a false premise and he's not very popular in his own state.”
pageContext.analysis: Utah senator Mitt Romney voted to convict Trump in the impeachment trial but he remains popular in his state, where he has a 50% approval rating, with 42% disapproving of his performance. "Utah voters overall reaction to Romney’s decision was 49% positive to 40% negative, with 11% not sure," the Desert News reported.
